meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
meanings.sent1: The elusiveness of the butterfly made it hard to catch.
meanings.sent2: The detective was frustrated by the elusiveness of the criminal.
meanings.sent3: The elusiveness of the answer to the riddle kept everyone guessing.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like the elusiveness of a fleeting shadow.
meanings.sent5: The elusiveness of the treasure map added to the excitement of the adventure.

meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to understand or define.
meanings.sent1: The elusiveness of the concept left the students confused.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher pondered the elusiveness of truth.
meanings.sent3: The elusiveness of the joke's punchline made it even funnier.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were lost in the elusiveness of the foggy morning.
meanings.sent5: The elusiveness of the ghost story gave everyone chills.
